event_id.description: Id of Event record in the Appeals-Consumer Application

detail_type.description: The type of the record created as a result of the intake

station.description: The station ID of the end product's station.

started_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the intake was created.

completion_started_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the user submitted the intake to be completed.

completed_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the intake was completed, whether it was successful or not.

completion_status.description: Indicates whether the intake was successful, or was closed by being canceled, expired, or due to an error. Allowable values are: success, canceled, expired, or error

type.description: The class name of the intake.

detail_type.description: The type of the record created as a result of the intake

bgs_last_synced_at.description: The last time in milliseconds cached BGS attributes were synced

date_of_death.description: The Veteran's date of death in logical type date int

payee_code.description: The payee_code of the claimant submitted for this end product.

type.description: The class name for the single table inheritance type of Claimant, for example VeteranClaimant, DependentClaimant, AttorneyClaimant, OtherClaimant, or HealthcareProviderClaimant.

participant_id.description: The participant ID of the claimant submitted on the end product.

claim_review.description: Either a Higher Level Review or a Supplemental Claim

auto_remand.description: True/false value to indicate whether or not this decision review (SupplementalClaim) is an automatically established remand.

benefit_type.description: The benefit type selected by the Veteran on their form, also known as a Line of Business.

filed_by_va_gov.description: Indicates whether or not this form cam from VA.gov

legacy_opt_in_approved.description: Indicates whether a Veteran opted to withdraw matching issues from the legacy process. If there is a matching legacy issue and it is not withdrawn then it is ineligible for the decision review.

receipt_date.description: Receipt date in logical type date int of the appeal form. Used to determine which issues are within the timeliness window to be appealed. Only issues decided prior to the receipt date will show up as contestable issues.

veteran_is_not_claimant.description: Selected by the user during intake, indicates whether the Veteran is the claimant, or if the claimant is someone else such as a dependent. Must be TRUE if Veteran is deceased.

establishment_attempted_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for the most recent attempt at establishing a claim.

establishment_last_submitted_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for the latest attempt at establishing the End Products for the Decision Review.

establishment_processed_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the End Product Establishments for the Decision Review successfully finished processing.

establishment_submitted_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the Higher Level Review was submitted by a Claims Assistant. This adds the End Product Establishment to a job to finish processing asynchronously.

informal_conference.description: Indicates whether a Veteran selected on their Higher Level Review form to have an informal conference. This creates a claimant letter and a tracked item in BGS.

same_office.description: Whether the Veteran wants their issues to be reviewed by the same office where they were previously reviewed. This creates a special issue on all of the contentions created on this Higher Level Review.

end_product_establishments.description: Either a Higher Level Review or a Supplemental Claim

benefit_type_code.description: 1 if the Veteran is alive, and 2 if the Veteran is deceased. Not to be confused with benefit_type, which is unrelated.

claim_date.description: The claim_date in logical type date int for end product established.

code.description: The end product code, which determines the type of end product that is established.

modifier.description: The end product modifier. For higher level reviews, the modifiers range from 030-039. For supplemental claims, they range from 040-049. The same modifier cannot be used twice for an active end product per Veteran. Once an end product is no longer active, the modifier can be used again.

payee_code.description: The payee_code of the claimant submitted for this end product.

reference_id.description: The claim_id of the end product, which is stored after the end product is successfully established in VBMS.

limited_poa_access.description: Indicates whether the limited Power of Attorney has access to view documents

limited_poa_code.description: The limited Power of Attorney code, which indicates whether the claim has a POA specifically for this claim, which can be different than the Veteran's POA

committed_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds indicating other actions performed as part of a larger atomic operation containing the end product establishment, such as creating contentions, are also complete.

established_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds for when the end product was established.

last_synced_at.description: The timestamp in milliseconds that the status of the end product was last synced with BGS. The end product is synced until it is canceled or cleared, meaning it is no longer active.

synced_status.description: The status of the end product, which is synced by a job. Once and end product is cleared (CLR) or canceled (CAN) the status is final and the end product will not continue being synced.

development_item_reference_id.description: When a Veteran requests an informal conference with their higher level review, a tracked item is created. This stores the ID of the of the tracked item, it is also used to indicate the success of creating the tracked item.

benefit_type.description: The benefit type selected by the Veteran on their form, also known as a Line of Business.

contested_issue_description.description: Description of the contested rating or decision issue. Will be either a rating issue's decision text or a decision issue's description.

contention_reference_id.description: The ID of the contention created on the End Product for this request issue. This is populated after the contention is created in VBMS.

contested_rating_decision_reference_id.description: The BGS id for contested rating decisions. These may not have corresponding contested_rating_issue_reference_id values.

contested_rating_issue_profile_date.description: If the contested issue is a rating issue, this is the rating issue's profile date in logical type date int. Will be nil if this request issue contests a decision issue.

contested_rating_issue_reference_id.description: If the contested issue is a rating issue, this is the rating issue's reference id. Will be nil if this request issue contests a decision issue

contested_decision_issue_id.description: The ID of the decision issue that this request issue contests. A Request issue will contest either a rating issue or a decision issue

decision_date.description: Either the rating issue's promulgation date, the decision issue's approx decision date or the decision date entered by the user (for nonrating and unidentified issues)

ineligible_due_to_id.description: If a request issue is ineligible due to another request issue, for example that issue is already being actively reviewed, then the ID of the other request issue is stored here.

ineligible_reason.description: The reason for a Request Issue being ineligible. If a Request Issue has an ineligible_reason, it is still captured, but it will not get a contention in VBMS or a decision.

is_unidentified.description: Indicates whether a Request Issue is unidentified, meaning it wasn't found in the list of contestable issues, and is not a new nonrating issue. Contentions for unidentified issues are created on a rating End Product if processed in VBMS but without the issue description, and someone is required to edit it in Caseflow before proceeding with the decision.

unidentified_issue_text.description: User entered description if the request issue is neither a rating or a nonrating issue

nonrating_issue_category.description: The category selected for nonrating request issues. These vary by business line.

nonrating_issue_description.description: The user entered description if the issue is a nonrating issue

remand_source_id.description: If an Appeal or Higher Level Review decision is remanded, including Duty to Assist errors, it automatically generates a new Supplemental Claim.  If this Supplemental Claim was generated, then the ID of the original Decision Review with the remanded decision is stored here.

untimely_exemption.name: untimely_exemption
untimely_exemption.description: If the contested issue's decision date was more than a year before the receipt date, it is considered untimely (unless it is a Supplemental Claim). However, an exemption to the timeliness can be requested. If so, it is indicated here.

untimely_exemption_notes.description: Notes related to the untimeliness exemption requested.

vacols_id.description: The vacols_id of the legacy appeal that had an issue found to match the request issue.

vacols_sequence_id.description: The vacols_sequence_id, for the specific issue on the legacy appeal which the Claims Assistant determined to match the request issue on the Decision Review. A combination of the vacols_id (for the legacy appeal), and vacols_sequence_id (for which issue on the legacy appeal), is required to identify the issue being opted-in.

closed_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds when the request issue was closed. The reason it was closed is in closed_status.

closed_status.description: Indicates whether the request issue is closed, for example if it was removed from a Decision Review, the associated End Product got canceled, the Decision Review was withdrawn.

contested_rating_issue_diagnostic_code.description: If the contested issue is a rating issue, this is the rating issue's diagnostic code. Will be nil if this request issue contests a decision issue.

ramp_claim_id.description: If a rating issue was created as a result of an issue intaken for a RAMP Review, it will be connected to the former RAMP issue by its End Product's claim ID.

rating_issue_associated_at.description: Timestamp in milliseconds when a contention and its contested rating issue are associated in VBMS.

nonrating_issue_bgs_id.description: If the contested issue is a nonrating issue, this is the nonrating issue's reference id. Will be nil if this request issue contests a decision issue.

nonrating_issue_bgs_source.description: The source of the prior decision.

request_issues.nonrating_issue_description: DTA Error - Other Recs: Dependency: Wendy Boyd, Not an Award Dependent, Turns 18, effective 01/01/2024
The user entered description if the issue is a nonrating issue

request_issues.contested_issue_description: Basic eligibility to Dependents' Educational Assistance is established from October 1, 2017.

X-VA-File-Number.description: The VBA corporate file number of the Veteran for this review. There can sometimes be more than one file number per Veteran.
